lesson.title: Token Approvals and Security
lesson.objective: Master ERC-20 approvals and protect your assets

sections.content: Before any protocol can move your tokens, you must explicitly approve it. This is a security feature - contracts can only spend what you authorize. But it's also a responsibility.
Unlimited approvals are convenient but risky. If a contract is exploited, attackers can drain approved tokens. Best practice: approve only what you need, and revoke approvals you no longer use.

content: approve() grants spending permission to a contract
Unlimited approvals persist even after transactions complete
Revoking approvals costs gas but increases security
Always verify the contract address before approving

questions.question: What does token approval allow a contract to do?
options: Spend your tokens up to the approved amount

questions.question: What is the safest approval practice?
options: Approve only what you need, revoke when done

nextSteps: Your tokens are now approved for use.
Remember to review and revoke old approvals periodically.
